title: playing video on Utube is always choppy
content: i can't log in with my Clickbank account password and e-mail address
creator: motazediamir06

title: Bad interaction between sync / restore and Default Bookmark Folder by Teddy Gustiaux
content:
Really bad day, I turned on some Ubuntu 22.04 machine I hadn't used in about six months and the next thing I notice is my bookmarks are completely thrashed. I attempt several restores after that and every time the bookmarks still look completely messed up.

Completely resigned to my fate I decide to disable Firefox extensions in a last effort to get back my precious bookmarks to a sane state and after that things look like they are supposed to (mostly).
creator: jptettamanti

title: Firefox Sync - export synchronizovaných panelů
content:
Zdravím.

Synchronizuji androidí mobil skrze FF Sync s win počítačem. Mobil se poškodil, musel jsem ho reinstalovat, panely/taby z jeho FF zmizely. (Mimochodem nepředpokládám, že by šly do mobilu nahrát zpátky? Třeba že bych ve FF Syncu přihlásil mobil pod stejným názvem, jako byl předtím, a panely by se nahrály? Spíš se bojím, že by je to ze Syncu smazalo)

Situace tedy je, že je mám je v počítači v ,,Synchronizovaných panelech".

Hledám možnost, jak je nějak zpracovat. Bohužel jich je velké množství na možnost ,,Otevřít vše v panelech" - FF spadne (v tomhle byla stará Opera mnohem stabilnější). Můžu je otevírat po jednom, jenomže taby nejdou v ,,Synchronizovaných panelech" zavírat (nebo jakkoliv označovat), takže se časem ztratím v tom, kde jsem skončil.

Nejsou ty linky třeba v nějakém souboru v profilu FF, ze kterého bych se je pokusil vytáhnout?
creator: frohlich.tomas

title: Excessive RAM use while restoring window
content:
Is there a way to restore a window using less RAM, or if applicable, with regular garbage collection during the process?

While restoring a previously closed window, significantly more RAM is used than when reopening a session, for the same amount of tabs. So if the window ever gets closed and that state saved, I need to revert to a previous session backup. Attempting to restore the window caused ram usage to go up to 30 gigabytes and beyond, at which point I stopped the process out of caution. In contrast reopening the browser with the tabs normally is only about 5 gigabytes.

I regularly use Firefox with thousands of tabs open. This is usually not an issue but in some cases leads to performance issues like these.
creator: oSpre

title: Fullscreen bugs when I switch to desktop
content:
For example, when I open a YouTube video on fullscreen, go to the desktop by pressing Win + D, and return to Firefox by pressing Win + D, the video is no longer on fullscreen, but my tabs and taskbar are invisible. It happens on every site with fullscreen, regardless of whether I watch video or play a web game.

I already tried to go into troubleshooting mode, but it did nothing. I also tried to remove fullscreen animation, but nothing again.

How to fix this bug?
creator: seva839n

title: cursor is freezing on this site

title: After closing all windows, session restore has lost a window.
content: This happens every time I restart Firefox. After "Close all windows" with 4 windows, session restore only restores 3. It seems to be the last window that was opened using "open new window". Off by one error? The tabs that were recently closed in that window aren't in the Recently Closed Tabs either. They do appear in "Show All History".
creator: peter.d.hill

title: Where is the data for Firefox Home page stored?
content: Clean Windows 11 install, but I have the previous one backed up. Since sync doesn't restore the frequently visited sites on the home page, where can I find the data to copy over myself?
creator: sintek

title: Opening links in Outlook 2021 emails (not outlook.com) resets Firefox theme to default and disables extensions
content:
Hey guys! 

    I'm running Win 10pro, Microsoft Office Pro Plus 2021 and Firefox X64.  I set Firefox as the default browser, but for some reason that setting isn't "sticking."  If Edge is installed, I can't find it.  Believe me, I tried, because I wanted to uninstall it if possible.

I'm still getting used to the new Outlook (I won't tell you what version I WAS using...) but this is throwing me for a loop...

If I do not have Firefox open: When I open a link in Outlook, a new window is opened in Firefox. This window does not include any toolbars nor are any of my customizations applied (themes, extensions) As a matter of fact, opening the link in this new bare-bones window disables all my extensions and if I want my theme back, I have to remove it from my theme manager and reinstall it, because the option to enable/disable the theme isn't there.

If I DO have Firefox open: When I open a link in Outlook, I get "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." If I close Firefox, I'll get that same bare-bones window and all my extensions and themes are disabled.

Has anyone seen anything like this before and can you help?

Thanks a bunch....
creator: demutthaus
